intro: Graphardisia ustupoana, commonly known as the Ustupoan spurge, is a flowering plant native to the humid tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its production of milky sap and often showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, arranged in clusters called cyathia, which are surrounded by vibrant yellow bracts. The plant is adapted to thrive in nutrient-rich soils and is often found in forest understories where it receives partial shade.
